content.description: The Crux is most likely the tree and not falling in it.  The route would probably be a lot better if the tree wasn't in the way.
content.location: between Tursiop's Leap and Sailing  on the first tier.

content.description: To the right of Sound Image on the first tier.

Moves up good edges on solid limestone with awkward movement through four bolts.  After clipping the fourth bolt the wall blanks out and you hit a height dependent crux to reach a decent sidepull.

(At 5' 7" +2" ape index I couldn't find a sequence that allowed me to hit the hold, I was about 2 inches shy using the best sequence I could figure out.)

The route is one you wouldn't want to take a big lead fall on because a tree has grown at the base of the route and follows you up the route always about 2 feet behind you. Tree tops out near the fourth bolt.
content.location: Route is the second route to the right of the chossy roof.

content.description: Fun Route. Edges and pinches lead to short section of slab that allows a no hands rest.  The business begins after the rest. Using edges and side pulls gain a block and prepare for a cryptic crux.  The very last move is the crux.
content.location: Route is the second to last route on the first terr. Just left of large tree.

content.description:
Route may have been fun back when it was bolted. Currently its falling off the side of the cliff.

Solid rock leads to choss.

May no longer go. Hold breakage is concentrated in middle of the route leaving a large blank section. If it goes it will be probably go harder than 12a.
content.location: Located to the left of choss roof. First route on the first terr. Route is left of Booga Beluga.

content.description: Starts off THIN(crux) followed by great moves to a rest, then head up, crimp an eyeball and tech it out for 2 bolts to a jug. From here,Â clip the last bolt and dance to the top.
20 feet of crack leads to face. Use side pulls and edges to bear hug up to block requiring a mantle. Finished on slab. Last move will keep you on your toes.
content.protection: Four bolts to chains. Stick clip the first bolt or bring medium gear. first bolt at 20'
content.location: Route is to the right of the choss roof. You will see the chossy roof as you approach the wall.

content.description: A slightly harder version of Sailing. It uses the same mantle shelf at the end to clip the anchor...don't Bail!
content.location: Last route on the lower tier.
